statement:
Let \(N\) denote the set of positive integers. A function \(f : \mathbb{N} \to \mathbb{N}\) is said to be \textit{bonza} if
\[f(a) \mid f(b)\quad\text{whenever}\quad a \mid b\]
for all positive integers \(a\) and \(b\). Determine the smallest real constant \(c\) such that \(f(n) \leq cn\) for all bonza functions \(f\) and all positive integers \(n\).

Let \(\Omega\) and \(\Gamma\) be circles with centres \(M\) and \(N\), respectively, such that the radius of \(\Omega\) is less than the radius of \(\Gamma\). Suppose the circles intersect at two distinct points \(A\) and \(B\). Let \(PQ\) be the common tangent of \(\Omega\) and \(\Gamma\) with \(P\) on \(\Omega\) and \(Q\) on \(\Gamma\). Prove that \(\angle MAN = \angle QAP\).

Determine all positive integers \(n\) for which there exists a sequence of positive integers \(a_1, a_2, \dots, a_n\) such that
\[a_1 a_2 \dots a_n = 2^n\quad\text{and}\quad a_1 + a_2 + \dots + a_n = 2n.\]

Let \(ABCD\) be a convex quadrilateral such that \(AB = AD\) and \(CB = CD\). The diagonals \(AC\) and \(BD\) intersect at point \(O\). A circle \(\omega\) passes through \(A\) and \(C\) and intersects the sides \(AB\) and \(AD\) again at points \(P\) and \(Q\), respectively. Prove that the lines \(BD\), \(PQ\) and the tangent to \(\omega\) at \(A\) are concurrent.

Two squirrels Bushy and Jumpy have collected 2025 walnuts for the winter. Jumpy numbers the walnuts from 1 through 2025 and digs 2025 little holes in a circular pattern in the ground around their favourite tree. The next morning Jumpy notices that Bushy had placed one walnut into each hole, but had paid no attention to the numbering. Jumpy decides to reorder the walnuts by performing a sequence of moves. In a single move, Jumpy chooses two walnuts and swaps their positions. Prove that Jumpy can achieve the correct ordering (walnut \(k\) in hole \(k\) for each \(k = 1, 2, \dots, 2025\)) using at most 2024 moves.

Determine all functions \(f : \mathbb{Z} \to \mathbb{Z}\) such that
\[f(x^2 + y^2) = f(x)^2 + f(y)^2\]
for all integers \(x\) and \(y\).
